thread.title: Area Roundup: Morris' McPherson finishes 36th at state golf
thread.title_full: Area Roundup: Morris' McPherson finishes 36th at state golf

title: Area Roundup: Morris' McPherson finishes 36th at state golf
text:
Area Roundup: Morris' McPherson finishes 36th at state golf Published: Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015 10:51 p.m. CDT Caption (Photo provided) Morris' Nick McPherson lines up a putt during the IHSA Class 2A state meet last weekend. By: STAFF REPORTS 
BLOOMINGTON – Morris golfer Nick McPherson qualified for the IHSA State Boys Golf Finals last weekend at Weibring Golf Course. On Friday, McPherson shot a 7-over par 78 which put him in 21st position in a field of 112. On Saturday, he shot a 13-over par 84 for a total score of 162 that put him in 36th place overall. 
“Although it’s not the finish he had hoped for, Nick did Morris Community High School, his family and his coach proud,” Morris coach Matt Lafond said. “Nick is one of only four golfers in the program’s history to qualify for state, and is one of only two golfers in the program’s history to qualify for state in consecutive years.” 
GIRLS TENNIS 
IHSA State Tournament: Morris’ Megan Davy won her first match of the day Thursday, defeating Lake Park’s Gina Odisho, 6-4, 6-2. She then lost to Rosary’s Maria Goheen, 6-0, 6-1, in the second round and dropped a 6-2, 6-1 decision to Jessie Mitchell of Chicago Payton in the consolation bracket. 
Emma Dingbaum lost her first match to Mackenzie Shelton of O’Fallon, 6-1, 6-0, before falling to Katya Shcherbyna of Wheaton Warrenville South, 6-0, 6-0, in the consolation bracket. The Morris doubles team of Autumn See and Alyssa Larsen went 0-2, losing to Jersey’s Ashton Tewell and Anne Snyders, 6-2, 6-4, in the first round and to Lincoln-Way East’s Jade Christensen and Kayla Reda, 6-2, 6-4. 
Coal City’s Carli McGinn lost her first-round match, 7-6 6-0, to Morgan Park’s Amai Johnson before beating Freeport’s Andrea Crase, 6-3, 6-3, in the consolation bracket. She then lost to Roxana’s Sydney Owsley, 6-1, 7-6 (7-5), in the second round of consolation play. 
The Coaler doubles team of Kaily Albrecht and Katie McGinn lost, 6-1, 6-1, to Audrey Angelos and Maya Trinka of Oak Park-River Forest in the first round and dropped a 5-7, 6-0, 10-5 decision to Sierra Sonnemaker and Erica Shangraw of Washington in the consolation bracket. 

AREA HIGH SCHOOL SPORTS SCHEDULE 
FRIDAY’S EVENTS 
7 p.m. - Coal City at Seneca 
7 p.m. - Plainfield North at Minooka 
7:15 p.m. - Morris at LaSalle-Peru 
VOLLEYBALL 
4 p.m.- Newark at Immaculate Conception Invitational 
5 p.m. - Minooka at Lyons Invitational 
7 p.m. - Gardner-South Wilmington at Grant Park 
SATURDAY’S EVENTS 
3 p.m. - Morris vs. Geneseo in Class 2A LaSalle-Peru Regional championship 
VOLLEYBALL 
8 a.m. - Newark at Immaculate Conception Invitational 
9 a.m. - Minooka at Lyons Invitational
